section.title: Creating a New DSL
section.para: Domain Specific Languages (DSL) allows to read your rules like natural language.
There is a wizard for creating a sample DSL file which is called from File > New > Domain Specific Language or using the menu with the JBoss Drools icon on the toolbar.
On the wizard page select the parent folder and give a proper name to your .dsl file. Then hit Finish to create a file and open it in the DSL editor.

section.title: Creating a New Business Rule
section.para: To create a rule this way, use the wizard menu. It will create an instance of a .brl file and open it in the Guided editor. The Guided editor works based on a .package file in the same directory as the .brl file. In this .package file you have the package name and import statements, just like you would in the top of a normal DRL file. So the first time you create a brl rule, you will need to populate the package file with the fact classes you are interested in.
